title: Talent 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oregon)
description: From a 1982 single vineyard planting, this thick, meaty and substantial wine includes 5% Syrah. Its plush fruit tones of black cherry and plum are compact and full bodied, with notes of black olive, sweet earth and toast that also factor in. The color is blood-black and the tannins are ripe and polished.

title: Frankland Estate 2014 Isolation Ridge Single Vineyard Shiraz (Frankland River)
description: This wine, from Frankland Estate's renowned Isolation Ridge, is a wonderful example of the greatness that cool-climate Great Southern Shiraz can achieve. Medium bodied and elegant, this enchanting shows red cherry, raspberry, florals, cracked pepper and herbs, with an orange peel tang and a hint of meat and earth in the background. The palate is full of crunchy red fruit, florals and dusty, fine-grained tannins that lead to a long, pepper finish. Drink now–2027.

title: Domaine Serene 2014 Triple S Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This new offering from purchased grapes is a doozy. Loaded with dried cherry, orange peel, almond paste and sea salt chocolate notes, it offers nonstop pleasure, with a toasty finish.

title: MacRostie 2014 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bold and ripe, this wine traffics in earthy wild raspberry, strawberry, mushroom and nutmeg. Ethereal despite its weight and breadth, it's made in a classic style and is deliciously varietal, a showcase of a great site in a great vintage.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)
description: A lovely wine, this is soft and layered with complex notions of raisin cake, cranberry and dried cherry. Soft and supple in texture, it has a lasting grip of leather and coffee. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, showing complexity and balance.

title: Barton 2014 Danger Zone Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: It's a shame only one barrel was made of this wine from Glenrose Vineyard, for it's a lavish and delicious wine. Aromas of coffee, espresso and dark chocolate meet with black cherry, lilacs and caramel on the nose. Deep yet bright black-currant fruit shows on the sip, along with zesty blood orange before finishing on the richer coffee-cream notes.

title: Howard Park 2014 Leston Shiraz (Margaret River)
description: This is an aromatic, pretty Shiraz from Margaret River. Dive into ripe strawberry, rhubarb, pepper, toasty spice and a little meatiness on the nose. Then wade in juicy fruit and a silky smooth texture on the medium-bodied palate which finishes on a grip of savory tannins.

title: Sanguis 2014 Pilgrim Red (Central Coast)
description: Tight aromas of blackberry, lilac and tar meet with burnt toast on this blend of Syrah, Grenache and Roussanne. There is a solid grip to the sip, where blackened blackberry flavors combine with tar, juniper, soy, pepper and caramel on the finish. Savory, this also has a strong acidic energy.

title: Sanguis 2014 The Eighth Veil White (Central Coast)
description: This atypical blend of Chardonnay and Marsanne presents a very smoky nose reminiscent of roasted poultry but cut by rosemary, yuzu, green tea, pomelo pith and fortune cookie aromas. Sandalwood, pluot, yellow melon and saffron flavors show on the exotic palate, which is tense with acidity and tannins and utterly distinctive.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Reserve Malbec (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a luscious, oaky and smoky red wine, with firm integrated tannins. Spicy acidity provides a freshness against the ripe fruit, leaning floral on the nose and offering plenty of length.

title: Briceland 2014 Phelps Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This substantive, well-structured wine has a classy, light French oak aroma and plenty of Bing cherry on the palate as well as firm tannins and good fruit acidity to make it feel lively. Its concentration and grip bode well for pairing with roast birds or beef.

title: Calluna 2014 Calluna Vineyards Cuvée Red (Chalk Hill)
description: Lean and strong, with a well-hewn balance of pungent compost, pencil shavings and dried herb, this Merlot-driven blend contains all five red Bordeaux varieties. Graceful and elegant, it's ready for the table, finishing in a twinge of tobacco and fennel.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pencil shaving aromas kick off this winery's top-shelf bottling, and then come hints of char, delicate but strong purple flowers and a core of blueberry on the nose. There is a tarry grip to the palate, where flavors of charred boysenberry, lilac and burnt caramel are very clean and elegant.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Nunes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is vibrantly bright and coiled in acidity. Leather, cola spice and dark cherry mingle effortlessly on a light, smooth and silky palate, ending in balanced nuance.

title: Summerland 2014 Theresa Noelle Estate Proprietors Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing aromas of rust, kirsch, dusty leather, crushed star anise, white pepper and li hing mui spice make for an earthy spicy nose on this reserve bottling. It's light in body and delicate in structure on the sip, combining baked earth, red fruit and a strong oregano touch on the finish.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2014 Syrah (Templeton Gap District)
description: Cola, baked black cherry, crushed gravel, spice cake and root beer aromas make for a very inviting nose on this bottling from one of Paso Robles' cooler regions. A baked-goods flavor starts the sip before crisp, tangy fruit, penetrating acidity and chalky tannins take hold.

title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2014 Julia's Estate Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is well structured and nicely balanced. It feels elegant on the palate and has an enticing array of complex aromas and flavors. Raspberry, wood smoke and tea scents are followed by nuances of plum, cedar and cinnamon, while fine-grained tannins and good acidity keep the mouthfeel fresh.

title: Clairault 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Both pretty and complex, Clairault's Cab is a heady mix of cranberry and tart cherry, florals, peppery herbs, pencil lead and some raw meat in the background. The palate is medium bodied and rustic yet elegant. Tannins are big but they seem a product of the skins rather than the oak, and there's a lovely savory, peppery finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Heath Vineyards 2014 Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Freshly pressed blueberries, tar, violets and baked blackberry cake show on the dense nose of this bottling by a winery in Texas. The sip is surprisingly delicate at first, with extreme floral flavors that are cut by black-currant cookies, char, black pepper and tar. The acidity rises into the finish.

title: Hentley Farm 2014 The Beast Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is indeed big and powerful, but it's elegant and classy too. Heady notes of violets, red berries, smoked meat, white pepper and licorice are entwined with tightly wound, fine-grained tannins. One for the cellar. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Rector Creek Vineyard Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Peppery, soft and supple, this blend of Cabernet Franc, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon is brawny and full bodied. It is a strongly concentrated wine with highlights of dried cherry, baked plum and dried herb.

title: Patton Valley 2014 The Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Ripe strawberry, raspberry, cranberry and red plum flavors, all bright and balanced, impress in this snappy, vibrant wine. The impact of minerally acids outweighs the 25% new oak, at least for now.

title: Portlandia 2015 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The fruit from this biodynamic vineyard has a grippy, earthy character that underscores the complexity in this wine. It's tannic and muscular, with black cherry fruit and subtle tanned leather, licorice, black pepper, coffee grounds and dark chocolate highlights that persist through its long, captivating finish.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The humble veteran Bruce McGuire has been making Syrah for decades, and this bottling offers stunning value. Lively aromas of tart black plum skins, white pepper, tar and rainy asphalt lead into a refreshingly acidic though complex sip with flavors of lavender, potpourri and blackberry juice that float across the palate.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 LPF Red (Adelaida District)
description: Dense aromas of woody blackberry, hints of bay leaf and thyme and a dusting of crushed graphite show on this elegant blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Petit Verdot. It's a very regal wine on the palate, with firm upright tannins conveying flavors of black plum, leather, tobacco and black pepper.

title: Van Duzer 2014 Saffron Fields Pinot Noir
description: More delicate than many of the winery's 2014 Pinots, this displays subtle tobacco notes around fragrant strawberry and red fruit flavors. Dried straw and chocolate highlights add welcome complexity. This cellar-worthy effort may be consumed immediately or tucked away for up to a decade.

title: Iris Vineyards 2014 Chalice Estate Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This very pretty wine is scented with rose petals and powdered fruit. It has a lovely cherry core with distinctive and unusual cumin and saffron accents. It seems to gain intensity in the glass, continuing through an elegant, extended finish.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Purple flowers, blueberry cream and a caramel richness live on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from one of the newer properties in the region. The mouthfeel is dense, the tannins are stiff and the acidity is bright, carrying flavors of charred meat, purple flowers, black pepper and extremely dark berries. It's still young, so drink 2019–2029.

title: NagyBrown 2014 Argument Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A careful hand is clearly at work here. A blend of Coury and 777 clones, it spent 18 months in half new oak, but it's the minerality and overall austerity that impress the most. Precise veins of stem, mineral and caramel flavors inflect its mysterious palate, which is marked by stiff, tight red berry fruit. Though labeled Willamette Valley, it would be surprising if this were not McMinnville AVA fruit.

title: Terragena 2014 Wiley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A classic light color and complex aromas like rhubarb, forest floor and raspberry precede lively red cherry, pomegranate and mushroom flavors on a lean and appetizing texture. This outstanding wine makes a great change of pace from the ponderous fruit-and-oak bombs.
